HTMLElementDir.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The <dir> HTML element is used as a container for a directory of files and/or folders, potentially with styles and icons applied by the user agent. Do not use this obsolete element; instead, you should use the {{HTMLElement("ul")}} element for lists, including lists of files.

blockquote.para: Warning: Do not use this element. Though present in early HTML specifications, it has been deprecated in HTML 4, and has since been removed entirely. No major browsers support this element.

remarks.para:
-Other list-related HTML Elements: ol, ul, li, and menu;
-CSS properties that may be specially useful to style the <dir> element:-The 'list-style' property, useful to choose the way the ordinal is displayed.
-CSS counters, useful to handle complex nested lists.
-The 'line-height' property, useful to simulate the deprecated compact attribute.
-The 'margin' property, useful to control the indent of the list.
